sub_title: Associate professor at Delft University of Technology
summary:
Research:
Current research projects involve studies on: measuring evaporation with glass fibre optic cables (DTS) and stable water isotopes which is part of my Veni (NWO). I aim to learn more about the evaporation process by combining new observation techniques in order to provide input for hydrological models and Remote Sensing products.

Teaching activities:
I am responsible for two courses: 4th year Master course 'Hydrological Measurements' (CIE4440) and 3rd year Minor course 'Meting aan Water' (CT3412MI). Furthermore, I am involved in the yearly field course to Luxembourg ('Hydrological fieldwork in river systems' CIE5471) and supervise several students at PhD, MSc and BSc level for their additional or final thesis.

Other:
- Secretary of Boussinesq Center for Hydrology
- Actively involved in organizing several sessions at EGU and an active member at the Hydrological Science Division
- Journal (assiociate) editor of HESS, Water Resources Research, and Ecohydrology

Specialties: Hydrology, Experimental hydrology, Hydrological modelling, GIS

awards.title: Veni
awards.description: Veni is targeted at outstanding researchers, who are at the start of their scientific career and display a striking talent for scientific research.The grant of 250,000 euros allows me to conduct research over a period of three years.

profile_positions.title: Assistant professor

profile_positions.description: My main research topics are related to rainfall interception and evaporation, where I combine field experiments with modelling. Furthermore, I am involved in the courses “Hydrological Measurements”, “Hydrological Fieldwork in Luxembourg”, and a new minor course "Measuring for water". Since 2009 I am a tutor for first year students Civil Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Researcher and Lecturer

profile_positions.description: PhD study on the role of interception in the hydrological cycle.
profile_positions.title: PhD researcher

profile_positions.description: PhD study on the role of interception in the hydrological cycle.
profile_positions.title: PhD researcher

profile_positions.description: Editing lecture notes, organizing and guiding several field trips to Luxembourg and Belgium, maintaining website, doing hydrological research, building measuring equipment, creating lecture sheets, (academic) posters, etc.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant "Hydrology"

profile_positions.description: Creating new lecture notes and lecture sheets for 3rd year course ‘Structural engineering 3’.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant "Structural Engineering"

profile_positions.description: Advising and deciding about educational affairs, guiding several committees (workshop, association magazine ‘ExtraCT’, 2nd year response group, educational discussions)
profile_positions.title: Board Member (Education)

volunteer_experiences.description: Organizing weekly meetings, weekend camps and summer camps for children from 11 to 14 years old.
Helping ±700 children (7-12 years old) to construct cottages from old/used timber for 1 week during their summer holidays (http://timmerdorp.com/)

volunteer_experiences.role: Committee member '1st year response group Education'​
volunteer_experiences.description: Providing feedback for the faculty and their lecturers to improve education/courses of Civil Engineering (TU Delft).
Organising two days were the parents of 1st and 2nd year BSc-students can meet the faculty of Civil Engineering (TU Delft).

volunteer_experiences.role: Secretary of Boussinsesq Center for Hydrology

volunteer_experiences.description: Emergency Response Officer at TU Delft. Helping people in case of emergencies at the university (first aid, evacuations)
